name: SKTexture
desc: An image, decoded on the GPU, that can be used to render various SpriteKit objects.

items.name: func size() -> CGSize
items.desc: Gets the size of the texture.

items.name: func textureRect() -> CGRect
items.desc: Gets a rectangle that defines the portion of the texture used to render its image.

items.name: var filteringMode: SKTextureFilteringMode
items.desc: The filtering mode used when the size of a sprite drawn with the texture is not drawn at the texture’s native size.

items.name: enum SKTextureFilteringMode
items.desc: Texture filtering modes to use when the texture is drawn in a size other than its native size.

items.name: var usesMipmaps: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the texture attempts to generate mipmaps.

items.name: func cgImage() -> CGImage
items.desc: Returns the texture’s image data as a Quartz 2D image.

items.name: func preload(completionHandler: () -> Void)
items.desc: Load texture data into memory, calling a completion handler after the task completes.

items.name: class func preload([SKTexture], withCompletionHandler: () -> Void)
items.desc: Load the data of multiple textures into memory.
